website_summaries.verdict: While not the most durable de-icer out there, this option looks great and is very affordable.
pros: Natural stone finish that blends in well
Comes with an energy-efficient thermostat and a 15-foot cord
cons: Some buyers note that many of these don't last beyond a season or two

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Our other pond de-icer (different brand) went out right before freezing temps and snow. As soon as this one arrived, I boiled water to make a hole and stuck this one in. The instructions say I could have sat it on top of the snow/ice and let it melt through but I didn’t want to wait for that since the top had a couple inches of ice and I was trying to save the fish from dying. So far, so good. The fish are alive and like to hang out near the de-icer. I also like that the cord is really long!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This Tetra heater is working terrific. Today is Jan. 22 and is 12 degrees here in PA. The pond heater is completely sealed, there is no ice in the pond. I haven't had any issues with the heater as stated by other reviewers, has a long cord that plugs directly into the outlet and seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: tim agentis

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I was using it in too small a container ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I was using it in too small a container (garden pond-tub for water lillies in mid-atlantic US) but it seemed to be "on" all the time, heating the water so that it was steaming in cold weather. Never seemed to turn off. Then this year started popping the GFCI, and when plugged into non-GFCI outlet, no heat.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Survived a Polar Vortex in Minnesota!!
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked this heater lasted the entire winter! It was buried in feet of snow and withstood a weeks worth of - 30 degree Temps. It was a horrible winter and thought my fish were done for sure but a little melted hole appeared!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Morreim

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I put the de-icer in my pond this Fall (2018) and so far it is keeping the surface from freezing over and the fish appear healthy. Without out it, some of my pond fish appeared to go into shock when the temperature suddenly dropped to nearly freezing but did not actually freeze. The last two years I have had trouble with other brands of de-icers suddenly failing over the course of their first winter. This brand looks quite different from the others so I'm giving it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Killed my koi :(
customer_reviews.text: The de-icer worked for a few days as freezing temperatures approached, keeping a hole open for my koi. However, this past week, we had a blizzard and the de-icer was useless. It froze over and did not do it’s job, so I had to create small holes each day so the koi could breath. Today is our first warm day and I went to check on the pond and saw all of my koi are dead. Horrible, cheap product that I do not recommend. I was lured by the cheap price and more appealing asthetic, but it obviously was worthless.
customer_reviews.author: giarose23

customer_reviews.title: Bes Based on Price vs Performance and Reliability
customer_reviews.text: We've had three different de-icers. This one has been the best.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work to keep opening in ice. Worthless. Would have selected “0” stars if I could! 3Feb.19, would have returned it if it wasn’t “frozen solid “ in the ice!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MildBill0311

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ELECTRICUTING fish!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is either constantly tripping my GFI or electrifying my fish pond. I don't use an extension cord with the product, and I have tested other appliances on my electrical circuit to ensure my circuit is functioning properly. Everything works great except for the de-icer. I'm out 75 bucks for the dead fish and the money I wasted on this product. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Tee_rox

customer_reviews.title: Did not work period!
customer_reviews.text: As my pond water began to freeze this unit also froze in the ice. It did not maintain any sort of opening between itself and the ice. The ice adheres to the fake plastic rock enclosure and I had to keep poring hot water on it to detach it from the ice and move it and try again. It was of no use to me and I do not recommend it. Tetra customer service did offer a refund so I did send it back.
customer_reviews.author: stacy evans

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work all winter as we had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t last our cold winter in Iowa. All our fish froze and died. Will try again next year and hopefully the temperature was just too low.
customer_reviews.author: Leah R.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with extra long cord. I installed it when ice had already formed on my small decorative pond and in two days the ice was gone. I didn’t install it until the last few weeks of winter and unplugged it once the outdoor temperature quit going below 20. It’s probably overkill for my pond but I’ll see how it does next winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I would recommend for a small outdoor pond.
customer_reviews.text: I will likely take a photo and attach it to this review, we had some really cold weather the last week here in the NE USA and my small pond started to freeze over bad. I had a 1500 watt unit that was a bit big for the pond but worked. Until this winter. So I tried this one. Did exactly as it was advertised. I placed it on the ice, a few hours later it melted a nice hole. It now allows for my air stone and pump to have a release through the ice and prevents this from freezing solid. My pond is a preformed Clover leaf plastic pond. It is around 70 gallons i think.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fails to work after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: The Tetra Pond heater stopped working during its second week of use. While it was working, the body of the heater continued to turn onto its side minimizing the amount of heat getting to the water. This was the second time I purchased this heater and the only problem I had the last time was the tipping on its side. I purchased this early, thinking I'd be ready for the winter season, but now the return date has passed.
customer_reviews.author: maddiedog

customer_reviews.title: Better to be safe than sorry!
customer_reviews.text: Had one l;ast year after our pond froze over the year before. THw pond remained open with just the one heater and the bubble air which is a separate item, all winter. Purchased another because I know as soon as the weather gets cold, we never know how cold it will get. Want to make sure I don't have to remove ice and frozen fish and frogs again. If the temperature goes too low, I have a second one on hand to help. 20 inch Koi are too expensive to replace especially when you are recovering from surgery and and you lose all 16!
customer_reviews.author: Twila Paradis

customer_reviews.title: first year
customer_reviews.text: well this thing is AMAZING, first year with it but it allowed our pond to flow all winter. we are In Cleveland OH so it gets COLD. I cant say how many years you get out of it but what I can say is I would purchase once a season if I needed just to keep my fish alive!
customer_reviews.author: JFelty

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Last
customer_reviews.text: This was the second of these that I purchased for my 400 gallon koi pond. The first one last two years and those winters had several very cold days and nights. It was a good de-icer. I thought two years was pretty good - even though the item has a three year warranty. This last one I bought barely last one year. And this winter has been very mild with no snow and night temps rarely below 32 degrees - mostly 25-28 degree zone. Not happy this one didn’t last. Think I’ll try another brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it, nice price and cord length!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for this winter and it’s working great so far. We have a small pond with a waterfall and large goldfish and the cord length is just right. I like the natural look of it - merely looks like a stone like so many others on our mountain. Price was very reasonable and I have had good luck with the quality of this brand for aquariums.
customer_reviews.author: Lash

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for good price.
customer_reviews.text: So far this winter season this has worked to keep my pond from freezing and my fish seem to be doing well despite the snow and freezing temperatures. I am using it for a small 75gallon pond and it seems to function as a heater for the pond. I would definitely purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Used in a turtle pond
customer_reviews.text: I use it in an outdoor turtle pond (150 gallon) Works great. I use it as a heater to help on the cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: iLL Gil 710

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my moms small pond and has already failed. It has been only 3 weeks from delivery and has already quit working. Very disappointed in quality. Would not recommend. She had a basic pond heater for 3 years and worked well, thought give this a go with all the reviews, nope. I should’ve bought what worked before and will do now.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great while it works, but a disposable annual purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 of these. They are great when they work, but they don't last. One lasted one winter and the other 1.5 winters. One stopped detecting temperature properly and stayed on red hot all the time, even when not necessary, until it burned out. The other rusted and just stopped working. It's a shame because of how well they work when they work, but these are only good if you consider them a disposable annual purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: TetraPond wins again.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pile of pond de-icers bought over the last 10 years and none have worked as expected. I have been pleased with this unit, as our temperatures have gone sub-zero and I still have a 2-3 foot area open and unfrozen. I will add this to my long list of great products from TetraPond.
customer_reviews.author: c.rt

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and seems to work well so far. I have had it for almost two weeks. My gold fish love it and cluster around it, happy to be so warm in the Michigan winter. It has not gotten below the 20's yet this year, so not a thorough test yet. I gave it 5 stars anyway, since it has been perfect so far.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: lasted only one season
customer_reviews.text: Worked grewt for our koi pond for a very cold Chicago winter but is no longer working. I ordered it after having to poor hot water in to keep a hole open until it came. When it came I plopped it in pond and worked all season. It seems to not be very hot after only one season. I had to buy new aerators as well. It would be nice to get two seasons out of one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in December 2018. Worked that winter season to keep a small opening in the ice, as it should. Now one year later it has shorted out and no longer works. Only used it 4 months in Dec-Mar 2019 and in Nov-Dec 2019, then it failed. Kept it inside the rest of the time. Should last longer for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Schreiner

customer_reviews.title: Takes on water, sinks
customer_reviews.text: Read a few reviews that said it takes on water and sinks. Still bought it. Worked great for two weeks. Then it sunk. Could returnmjt and vet a new one, hit the reason it sunk is a manufacturing fault. It's not sealed properly, obviously. so indent want to risk getting another bunk one, I'm just getting my money back and looking at diffrent brands. Sucks. Update. They have sent me a new one, immediately. Pleasantly surprised maybey they'll change my mind after all....
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I put it in my pond it does turn on and off with the weather seems to be working just great all my fish survive the winter and we're huge the following spring this is my second year and I think it will work just fine. But I think it uses a lot of electricity
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ann

customer_reviews.title: way too hot for my small pond
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept but I thought it was only going to barely heat the water and my pond was like bath water within a day and it killed my fish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable pond warming
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pond de-icer of the same brand. The previous one failed in the second year, but that appears to be the norm. I think my earlier deicer was fewer watts which kept a hole open while this 300-watt heater keeps the entire pond surface open (small pond about 65 gallons).
customer_reviews.author: P. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works. Put in pond a month ago and bottom is rusty already. Hope it lasts through the season.
customer_reviews.author: Illinois Mom

customer_reviews.title: Use a timer for coldest points
customer_reviews.text: So far very reliable and efficient. I set up with a timer to come on for short intervalls at coldest points and it has kept water feature clear and fish happy. Going to get another one for the pond to replace the "tank" deicer because it also is less intrusive and more attractive
customer_reviews.author: outlawdogs

customer_reviews.title: Lived up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Installed this product in my small koi pond. Just went through 2 days of sub zero Polar Vortex and it worked like a champ. Kept some open water the whole time. As a plus, the koi seem to “snuggle up” to it, so I have seen them more this winter than previous years and know they are alive and well.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: For only 300 watts it does a very good job.
customer_reviews.text: Had for 10 days and works great so far. For only 50 watts more it clears a much larger area than a 250 watt competitor that failed. About 4x4 at 20 degrees. Update: minus 3 degrees and a 4x4 foot area still completely ice free. This the best I have seen from any small (250 gallons) pond heater. Much better than the red or green one and the cord is longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: My old heater kept tripping the circuit breaker on the circuit into which it was plugged. This heater is lower wattage, but still did the job. It is also less obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: well heating my little pond
customer_reviews.text: it prevented water from freezing in my little pond,but at the same time, it was totally corroded within one winter. Now another winter is coming and I am thinking, I should buy another one? Why did it corrode in regular, clean pond water?
customer_reviews.author: Mark Quotchavyuk

customer_reviews.title: set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.text: I found the heater to be a set it and for get it heater. I set my heater at 78 degrees and it holds it at 78, will see 79 when heater is adjusting down and 77 when time to adjust up but pretty much stay at 78.
customer_reviews.author: Royce White

customer_reviews.title: One Works Like A Champ the other trips the breaker.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for two different ponds, and at first they worked great. They do stay on and don't shut off as the water temperature rises, which is fine for what I needed, After only a few weeks, I went to plug one of them back in before the next freeze and it continually trips the breaker. I tried it in the location of the second one and the same thing happened. Clearly an issue with the unit. And of course it went out the day before a big freeze is coming. I did go ahead and order another one because overall I am pleased with the product. I just got one that went bad. :/ .
customer_reviews.author: PRP

customer_reviews.title: Shorts out
customer_reviews.text: This worked great and looked good, but it stopped working during the first winter and shorts out the line. When I unplug it, the line stays active. As soon as I plug it in, the line goes dead. It looks like it has corroded along the seam, allowing water entry ... and a short circuit. Will have to find something more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with heater. Pond is clear. Construction looks very rugged. Will take several winters to confirm. Nice that it does not take up so much space and does not have exposed element that gets all cruded up with plants.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Not good for less than 100gal
customer_reviews.text: This rock works really well... too well for me. It literally boiled my fancy goldfish in my 90 gal pond. I came outside on the second morning to see steam coming off the water. Out of eight I have two left who are looking sickly. For a larger pond I'm sure it would work very well, but apparently I was a fool and now my fish are roasted. F
customer_reviews.author: sayeild

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to keep my Koi pond from freezing over in the winter...didn't work...the ice froze right over it. Bad purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Hot Rock Rocks
customer_reviews.text: It kept my little pond and circulating pump flowing through the coldest nights. 1 season close to over. Will clean it and store it and see if it'll make it through the next season.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Gets to hot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my pond and it got to hot and killed all my fish. It got so hot that my pond was actually steaming, I do not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better-than-expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this pond heater. I have a small koi pond and this thing has been amazing. With temperatures getting down in single digits my pond, waterfall and fountains are operating just fine. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: M. Ulrich

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat is a a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Cooked my fish. When i pulled it from my Pulled from my pond it was still on and The water temp was 105 f.
customer_reviews.author: JFM

customer_reviews.title: Okay for mild Winters but won't last a whole winter up north.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is wonderful, however after four units I've never had one last the entire winter.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: No se
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only one last winter Out of nowhere it just keeps tripping beaker when I plug it to the outlet
customer_reviews.author: mario castro

customer_reviews.title: Plan on buying yearly
customer_reviews.text: This deicer is Great for one year and then has to be replaced due to corrosion on the bottom . Problem is that the price goes up $10-15.00 a year
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Sort of, kind of still works after one year
customer_reviews.text: Had it kept working it would have been great. The rock floater got waterlogged some how and wants to sink.... Small pond, no physical abuse. It runs nonstop also. When it was warm out in spring I went to remove it and it nearly burnt my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Branden A Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked great for the first year. Went to install it the second year and it kept tripping the breakers. Decided to replace with the same one and it immediately tripped the GFCI outlets. Will not give it a 3rd chance. Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew and Noelle Drake

customer_reviews.title: JUNK !!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute JUNK! Do NOT waste your money. Did not last 4 months in a mild Colorado winter. Began falling apart now its only use is to trip my breaker. Absolute JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: matt s.

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat did not work
customer_reviews.text: This product did work and kept a hole in my pond however, the thermostat did not shut off when temps went above freezing. This prevented my fish from hibernating as they spent most of the winter around the artificial stone like a feeding troth. Returned item since it has a 3 year warranty
customer_reviews.author: JANE L BROOKE-STEWART

customer_reviews.title: Pond Deicer works great
customer_reviews.text: Our little Koi pond always froze over and would trap the frogs and not let any oxygen in for the fish. This unit works real good. Every time I go look the fish are always swimming under and around it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Layne

customer_reviews.title: They are quite happy and warm
customer_reviews.text: Working well and this will be the first time my fish survive the Pittsburgh winter! They are quite happy and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Annod

customer_reviews.title: Sink, sank, sunk.
customer_reviews.text: I put it on top of the water, the next day it was under the water and the ice had frozen over. I still haven't been able to pull it out of the ice.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMunky

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: So far this winter it has been amazing. Fish are still alive and half of my pond doesn't freeze no matter what because of it
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It works and I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This one has lasted so far through the winter as to the other brands shorted out or just stopped working. Very satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tony the Solardude

customer_reviews.title: Quit working a little over a month after using
customer_reviews.text: This de-over seemed to work ok leaving an inch or two of no ice around the rock. A little over a month after using it it just stopped working. I would definitely not recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works but need thermostat improvement
customer_reviews.text: Kept pond going over winter. Thermostats on both units defund and simply stays on, as I discovered when ambient temperature was in the 70’s. Earlier unit burned out after two winters.
customer_reviews.author: Kramian

customer_reviews.title: Right sized product for my pond
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 4 years ago and it worked fine for 3 years. Right sized product for my 300 gallon Koi pond in PA. I bought the same item again in January 2018, and it never worked - didn't thaw any ice I am returning for a replacement. I still believe in the product. I may have just gotten unlucky with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Terry T.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. No longer works after 2 months of use in our small pond. Outside temperatures never dropped below 20 degrees. Brought it inside and placed it in a big bowl of water. plugged into a different outlet. It's completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: Wish it would have a built in led to let you know when it kicks on. Otherwise it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Ferndale Michigan

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after the first year but good warranty
customer_reviews.text: We loved this for our pond for the first winter but when we put it back in for this winter, the heating element wasn't working anymore. Luckily Tetra was easy to contact and the product carries a 3 year warranty so they are sending out a replacement. I'm hoping it was a fluke and that this one lasts for many winters - I'll keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: M S

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is no good. Purchased one in the fall of 2018. In January 2019 it started popping the GFI. . Ordered a replacement and it popped the GFI this fall. Good for about 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nowak

customer_reviews.title: worked once
customer_reviews.text: I have a small pond, so i waited until it froze over. The first time i used it, it worked great. Then the weather got warm, the pond melted (i took it off before it melted). Then we got really cold weather and the pond started to freeze up again, so i put it back on the pond and it doesn't work now. Was going to send it back, but I missed the return period by 21 days.
customer_reviews.author: julie ecker

customer_reviews.title: Quality de-icer
customer_reviews.text: Great pond de-icer. Works great in our small back yard pond. We are in upstate NY where it gets very cold and this works like a charm
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I went to put it into the water a week ago for the winter and got an electric shock. Probably kicked all my koi. Dangerous and should not be sold!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Amador

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: worked better than expected fish are very happy now an so am I
customer_reviews.author: Jack C. Nicol

customer_reviews.title: great heat source
customer_reviews.text: my husband bout this for our outside koi pond for cold winter days and nights and so far it has worked wonderful it keeps the water 65 at all times the only downfall is i wish there was an on off switch so we dont have to unplug it everytime we get warmer weather
customer_reviews.author: J. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Kept My Koi Pond and Waterfall Working all Winter
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of other pond heaters that didn't do the job. This one not only looks nice, but kept a nice size clear spot in the ice and enabled my waterfall to continue running.
customer_reviews.author: Lanny Fahlenkamp

customer_reviews.title: Fits in small area.
customer_reviews.text: It is too warm now to use. I do like the size. It will fit in the small pond.
customer_reviews.author: mae

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This worked for one season only.. I had one previously that worked for two seasons only. Will NOT by this product again.
customer_reviews.author: I. Fischman

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great, for 2 years, tripped gci breaker. Found to be water inside. Seam line was below water line. Hope the seam is raised above water line. I'm buying it again, I'll seal it if seam not raised.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 4 months. After 4 months it started to trip the fuse as soon as it's plugged in and no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice heater.
customer_reviews.text: Fish are crowded around their new heater during these freezing temps. Nice long cord.
customer_reviews.author: SVUY

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my Tetra Pond de-icer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small pond with three fish in it and this has done a great job keeping the pond from freezing over. And, it looks like part of the landscaping rock. Super happy! Time will tell if this will last through more winters.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: so far it is still working and keep a little ...
customer_reviews.text: so far it is still working and keep a little part of my pond unfrozen so my fishes have enough oxygen
customer_reviews.author: valerie mendelson

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: STAY TRASH!!! DOESNT WORK ANYMORE AFTER 2 MONTHS!!! RIP OFF
customer_reviews.author: Chic S.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Returned the first one because it stopped working and pond froze over. Got another one and it did the same!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product did not prevent ice from forming (at all!!) in my 300-gallon stock-tank pond. I would NOT recommend it. Trying to get my money back now.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Krogman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bottom of the heater rusted after 3 months in front he water.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Kept 50 gallon pond completely ice free
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one . The first one worked great until it swelled and water got inside it and my wife got shocked even though I had a GFCI circuit on the pond. This one I have not used yet but I have smeared silicone all around the seam to possibly help prevent that from happening again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Half of my koi pond froze, it was the half with the heater. The other half had my aerator that kept it clear of ice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Beshears

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great for my pond. I lost some fish last winter. This saved the rest.
customer_reviews.author: David Howard

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far!
customer_reviews.text: The goldfish in our pond seem to appreciate it! No problems, easy installation!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E

customer_reviews.title: That it works properly and keeps my fish alive!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to tell if it's on it off. There isn't any type of identification on it to let you if it's on or off. You just plug it in and that's it. My fish love it though, they hang out under it like cows feeding from a trough! It's quite funny to see them like that!
customer_reviews.author: Nan P

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works well and seems to water tight. I had trouble with other heaters tripping my ground fault breaker. So far no problems had it the pond around a month now
customer_reviews.author: John Peluso

customer_reviews.title: make koi great again
customer_reviews.text: keeps an open area on a small pond (10x6) free of ice even at -10!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Roden

customer_reviews.title: Best de-icer I have ever found!!
customer_reviews.text: I lose fish every winter even with drivers but this product kept a huge circumference completely unfrozen...not one fish died and I attribute it to this product. I bought a second!
customer_reviews.author: DocGreenfrog

customer_reviews.title: Pond heater from reputable company
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace old pondmaster heater that failed to float after first year of use. I like the rock look of this heater instead of the big red disc. Long enough cord to help placement in pond
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D.

customer_reviews.title: Saved our fish over winter in the north east
customer_reviews.text: Saved our 30 fish super great product great price great delivery
customer_reviews.author: Martin D. Siry

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for long
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one to fail and it only lasted 1 hour. I read the instructions and double checked on the web to make sure I was not missing something or misusing it. Just does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great - our old one died so this is a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Erickson

customer_reviews.title: It cleans easily and we did not lose any fish due to ...
customer_reviews.text: This de-icer worked very well over the winter. It cleans easily and we did not lose any fish due to the cold. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: cortney

customer_reviews.title: Tubing connections broke during setup
customer_reviews.text: We're just unpacking this to set it up and as it's getting put together, the end of the main suction tube cracked and broke. The setup instructions are not clear and we're disappointed that before it's even set up we're having to tape it together.
customer_reviews.author: Megan C. Moloney

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: It works and makes then ice melt about 6 inch all around the heater. Fishes stay alive!
customer_reviews.author: Sam M

customer_reviews.title: Pond Deicer
customer_reviews.text: Product developed a leak after two winters. Has a three year warranty. Contacted the company and a replacement was sent out inside a week. Great customer service. Hopefully the replacement will keep water tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jbar

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Kept an open area in my pond no matter how cold it was outside.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: bullfrogs love it. A couple days in winter
customer_reviews.text: bullfrogs love it. A couple days in winter, they croaked for mates. Not sure if they were lucky. :)
customer_reviews.author: Trina

product_meta.title: TetraPond De-Icer, Thermostatically Controlled Winter Survival Solution For Fish, UL Listed
feature_bullets: POND DE-ICER Keeps an area of your pond free from ice
WINTER SURVIVAL SOLUTION Allows toxic gases from decaying matter to escape from under ice during the winter
EFFECTIVE Works in temperatures as low as -20 degrees
300-WATTS Features a 15 foot power cord and thermostatically controlled shutoff
NATURAL FINISH Stone finish complement’s your pond’s surroundings
